svg.content: <mxfile host="Electron" modified="2022-09-08T09:23:31.191Z" agent="5.0 (X11; Linux x86_64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) draw.io/20.2.8 Chrome/102.0.5005.167 Electron/19.0.15 Safari/537.36" etag="c8fo3yP_-nSdnuoPVRIZ" version="20.2.8" type="device"><diagram id="6d1HaLb_pV4ha_MXZZ7F" name="Page-1"></diagram></mxfile>

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe center; justify-content: unsafe center; width: 1px; height: 1px; padding-top: 20px; margin-left: 400px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0px; text-align: center;
display: inline-block; font-size: 19px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; font-weight: bold; white-space: nowrap;

div.div: Truth

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe center; justify-content: unsafe center; width: 1px; height: 1px; padding-top: 20px; margin-left: 440px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0px; text-align: center;
display: inline-block; font-size: 19px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; font-weight: bold; white-space: nowrap;
display: flex; align-items: unsafe center; justify-content: unsafe center; width: 1px; height: 1px; padding-top: 20px; margin-left: 490px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0px; text-align: center;
display: inline-block; font-size: 19px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; font-weight: bold; white-space: nowrap;

div.div: Wisdom

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe center; justify-content: unsafe center; width: 1px; height: 1px; padding-top: 60px; margin-left: 70px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0px; text-align: center;
display: inline-block; font-size: 19px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; white-space: nowrap;
display: flex; align-items: unsafe center; justify-content: unsafe flex-start; width: 132px; height: 1px; padding-top: 60px; margin-left: 150px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0px; text-align: left;
display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; white-space: normal; overflow-wrap: normal;

div.div: In order for a truth to be accepted, it has to be validated.

switch.text: In order for a truth t...

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe center; justify-content: unsafe flex-start; width: 332px; height: 1px; padding-top: 170px; margin-left: 30px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0px; text-align: left;
display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; white-space: normal; overflow-wrap: normal;

div.div: In order for there to be a way of validating any truth, there will need to be a set of agreements in place that constitute what is valid and what is not valid... and that can be very biased by culture and other influences.

switch.text: In order for there to be a way of validating any truth,...

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe center; justify-content: unsafe flex-start; width: 137px; height: 1px; padding-top: 160px; margin-left: 425px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0px; text-align: left;
display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; white-space: normal; overflow-wrap: normal;

div.div: The point being that this truth that we speak of and about is contextual...

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe center; justify-content: unsafe flex-start; width: 127px; height: 1px; padding-top: 260px; margin-left: 430px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0px; text-align: left;
display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; white-space: normal; overflow-wrap: normal;

div.div: And can thus only be a partial expression of the whole truth.

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe center; justify-content: unsafe flex-start; width: 184px; height: 1px; padding-top: 360px; margin-left: 401px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0px; text-align: left;
display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; white-space: normal; overflow-wrap: normal;

div.div: Just like any eye-witness report, which is taken as a test of validity... and a rough test at that.

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe center; justify-content: unsafe flex-start; width: 222px; height: 1px; padding-top: 290px; margin-left: 85px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0px; text-align: left;
display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; white-space: normal; overflow-wrap: normal;

div.div: It is like the material manifestation of the essence of the item.

switch.text: It is like the material manifestation...

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe center; justify-content: unsafe flex-start; width: 270px; height: 1px; padding-top: 390px; margin-left: 61px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0px; text-align: left;
display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; white-space: normal; overflow-wrap: normal;

div.div: One of its characteristics, is that you will find this essence expressed in the many versions of any "manifest/visible" truth.

switch.text: One of its characteristics, is that you will...

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe center; justify-content: unsafe center; width: 118px; height: 1px; padding-top: 480px; margin-left: 1px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0px; text-align: center;
display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; white-space: normal; overflow-wrap: normal;

div.div: Two examples:

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe center; justify-content: unsafe center; width: 118px; height: 1px; padding-top: 480px; margin-left: 201px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0px; text-align: center;
display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; white-space: normal; overflow-wrap: normal;
display: flex; align-items: unsafe center; justify-content: unsafe center; width: 118px; height: 1px; padding-top: 620px; margin-left: 1px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0px; text-align: center;
display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; white-space: normal; overflow-wrap: normal;
display: flex; align-items: unsafe center; justify-content: unsafe center; width: 118px; height: 1px; padding-top: 620px; margin-left: 161px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0px; text-align: center;
display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; white-space: normal; overflow-wrap: normal;
display: flex; align-items: unsafe center; justify-content: unsafe center; width: 388px; height: 1px; padding-top: 760px; margin-left: 1px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0px; text-align: center;
display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; white-space: normal; overflow-wrap: normal;

div.div: Only group into what we call the elements. Which are atoms, made of the same structure (truth), but manifesting it in different ways. These differences are peceivable, and thus measurable, by us.

switch.text: Only group into what we call the elements. Which are atoms, made...

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe center; justify-content: unsafe center; width: 326px; height: 1px; padding-top: 860px; margin-left: 33px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0px; text-align: center;
display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; white-space: normal; overflow-wrap: normal;

div.div: But, because we have no way, no present technology, or science, with which to view any charactertics that might differentiate between different atoms, does not mean that there is not.

switch.text: But, because we have no way, no present technology, or...

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe center; justify-content: unsafe center; width: 118px; height: 1px; padding-top: 860px; margin-left: 544px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0px; text-align: center;
display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; white-space: normal; overflow-wrap: normal;

div.div: However, with people, we can see individual differences.

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe center; justify-content: unsafe center; width: 333px; height: 1px; padding-top: 960px; margin-left: 436px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0px; text-align: center;
display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; white-space: normal; overflow-wrap: normal;

div.div: But do not get lost in the woods, because there are also a certain human "structure" that makes up all the different human "types" or elements, all responding according to the same algorithm of character.

switch.text: But do not get lost in the woods, because there are also...

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe center; justify-content: unsafe center; width: 276px; height: 1px; padding-top: 1050px; margin-left: 465px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0px; text-align: center;
display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; white-space: normal; overflow-wrap: normal;

div.div: This is upheld by the fact that there are only a certain range of emotions that human's generally feel - and they have a priority rating.

switch.text: This is upheld by the fact that there are only...

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe center; justify-content: unsafe center; width: 118px; height: 1px; padding-top: 1020px; margin-left: 1px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0px; text-align: center;
display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; white-space: normal; overflow-wrap: normal;
display: flex; align-items: unsafe center; justify-content: unsafe center; width: 118px; height: 1px; padding-top: 1020px; margin-left: 201px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0px; text-align: center;
display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; white-space: normal; overflow-wrap: normal;

div.div:
Contextual
Truth

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe center; justify-content: unsafe center; width: 118px; height: 1px; padding-top: 1110px; margin-left: 201px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0px; text-align: center;
display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; white-space: normal; overflow-wrap: normal;

div.div:
Needs mathematics;
a clear def. of `m` and `a`

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe center; justify-content: unsafe center; width: 138px; height: 1px; padding-top: 1120px; margin-left: 360px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0px; text-align: center;
display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; white-space: normal; overflow-wrap: normal;

div.div: Though `a`, acceleration, already consists of "force".

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe center; justify-content: unsafe center; width: 219px; height: 1px; padding-top: 1120px; margin-left: 536px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0px; text-align: center;
display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; white-space: normal; overflow-wrap: normal;

div.div: And what is force anyways? Does it exist? We cannot see it, smell it, hear it, or touch it - but we can "feel" it.

switch.text: And what is force anyways? Does it ex...

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe center; justify-content: unsafe center; width: 118px; height: 1px; padding-top: 1230px; margin-left: 500px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0px; text-align: center;
display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; white-space: normal; overflow-wrap: normal;

div.div: The force is in the action itself.

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe center; justify-content: unsafe center; width: 118px; height: 1px; padding-top: 1330px; margin-left: 500px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0px; text-align: center;
display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; white-space: normal; overflow-wrap: normal;

div.div: Just as the spirit is in the body!

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe center; justify-content: unsafe center; width: 118px; height: 1px; padding-top: 1230px; margin-left: 664px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0px; text-align: center;
display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; white-space: normal; overflow-wrap: normal;

div.div: Which we only experience by the effect of the force.

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe center; justify-content: unsafe center; width: 118px; height: 1px; padding-top: 1320px; margin-left: 664px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0px; text-align: center;
display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; white-space: normal; overflow-wrap: normal;

div.div: We started off, big effect, big force.

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe center; justify-content: unsafe center; width: 181px; height: 1px; padding-top: 1425px; margin-left: 633px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0px; text-align: center;
display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; white-space: normal; overflow-wrap: normal;

div.div: But that is linear thinking, and we grew up, and began to think in more subtle terms, until we discovered....

switch.text: But that is linear thinking, a...

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe center; justify-content: unsafe center; width: 118px; height: 1px; padding-top: 1520px; margin-left: 661px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0px; text-align: center;
display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; white-space: normal; overflow-wrap: normal;

div.div:
Non-linear,
process
thinking....

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe center; justify-content: unsafe center; width: 118px; height: 1px; padding-top: 1180px; margin-left: 1px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0px; text-align: center;
display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; white-space: normal; overflow-wrap: normal;

div.div: So what is being said here is actually very simple

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe center; justify-content: unsafe center; width: 198px; height: 1px; padding-top: 1220px; margin-left: 166px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0px; text-align: center;
display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; white-space: normal; overflow-wrap: normal;

div.div: Force equals the amount of "work" done. By measuring the effect(s), we calculated the force that might have been needed to elicit such a potent reaction.

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe center; justify-content: unsafe center; width: 118px; height: 1px; padding-top: 1330px; margin-left: 1px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0px; text-align: center;
display: inline-block; font-size: 20px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; white-space: normal; overflow-wrap: normal;

div.div:
cause/effect
result

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe center; justify-content: unsafe center; width: 288px; height: 1px; padding-top: 1330px; margin-left: 156px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0px; text-align: center;
display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; white-space: normal; overflow-wrap: normal;

div.div:
Cause is the force,
effect is the measurable change,
result is where we take our "final" measurments.

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe center; justify-content: unsafe center; width: 118px; height: 1px; padding-top: 1430px; margin-left: 161px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0px; text-align: center;
display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; white-space: normal; overflow-wrap: normal;

div.div: Effect is the measured change in state or position.

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe center; justify-content: unsafe center; width: 118px; height: 1px; padding-top: 1430px; margin-left: 331px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0px; text-align: center;
display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; white-space: normal; overflow-wrap: normal;

div.div: If initial is where the measurment began, the result is where the measurement ends.

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe center; justify-content: unsafe center; width: 23px; height: 1px; padding-top: 1575px; margin-left: 36px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0px; text-align: center;
display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; white-space: normal; overflow-wrap: normal;

div.div: X

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe center; justify-content: unsafe center; width: 18px; height: 1px; padding-top: 1573px; margin-left: 161px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0px; text-align: center;
display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; white-space: normal; overflow-wrap: normal;

div.div: Y

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe center; justify-content: unsafe center; width: 118px; height: 1px; padding-top: 1500px; margin-left: 1px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0px; text-align: center;
display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; white-space: normal; overflow-wrap: normal;

span.style: color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-family: helvetica; font-size: 12px; font-style: normal; font-weight: 400; letter-spacing: normal; text-align: center; text-indent: 0px; text-transform: none; word-spacing: 0px; background-color: rgb(248, 249, 250); display: inline; float: none;

br.style: color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-family: helvetica; font-size: 12px; font-style: normal; font-weight: 400; letter-spacing: normal; text-align: center; text-indent: 0px; text-transform: none; word-spacing: 0px; background-color: rgb(248, 249, 250);

span.style: color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-family: helvetica; font-size: 12px; font-style: normal; font-weight: 400; letter-spacing: normal; text-align: center; text-indent: 0px; text-transform: none; word-spacing: 0px; background-color: rgb(248, 249, 250); display: inline; float: none;

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe center; justify-content: unsafe center; width: 118px; height: 1px; padding-top: 1500px; margin-left: 141px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0px; text-align: center;
display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; white-space: normal; overflow-wrap: normal;

div.div: Final form,

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe center; justify-content: unsafe center; width: 118px; height: 1px; padding-top: 1640px; margin-left: 33px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0px; text-align: center;
display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; white-space: normal; overflow-wrap: normal;

div.div: Force,

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe center; justify-content: unsafe center; width: 118px; height: 1px; padding-top: 1730px; margin-left: 33px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0px; text-align: center;
display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; white-space: normal; overflow-wrap: normal;

div.div:
has direction (generally),
unless it is a force field

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe center; justify-content: unsafe center; width: 118px; height: 1px; padding-top: 1820px; margin-left: 33px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0px; text-align: center;
display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; white-space: normal; overflow-wrap: normal;

div.div:
Which, if dense enough, may become
a recognisable
form

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe center; justify-content: unsafe center; width: 1px; height: 1px; padding-top: 1420px; margin-left: 60px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0px; text-align: center;
display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; white-space: nowrap;
display: flex; align-items: unsafe center; justify-content: unsafe center; width: 1px; height: 1px; padding-top: 1500px; margin-left: 320px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0px; text-align: center;
display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; white-space: nowrap;
display: flex; align-items: unsafe center; justify-content: unsafe center; width: 1px; height: 1px; padding-top: 1617px; margin-left: 184px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0px; text-align: center;
display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; white-space: nowrap;
display: flex; align-items: unsafe center; justify-content: unsafe center; width: 1px; height: 1px; padding-top: 1650px; margin-left: 540px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0px; text-align: center;
display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; white-space: nowrap;

div.div:
So, in summary, this magical element we call Force,
causes some change to occur in something we call Form.
This is representated by the mathematical mantra
F=ma...
Now, is this statement true?
Yes, within the conext of mathematics.
And outside of that context,
it has the "reality/truth" of its own.
I mean, whether there are human beings to record this force or not,
it still occurs, and that is the truth/reality that we "speak" of.

switch.text: So, in summary, this magical element we call Force,...

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe center; justify-content: unsafe center; width: 1px; height: 1px; padding-top: 1848px; margin-left: 492px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0px; text-align: center;
display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; white-space: nowrap;

div.div:
One could say that physics preceded mathematics.
Mathematics just being the best language we believe we have
come up with to express the world around us.
Unfortunatly, it has a dark side too. It also
seeks to manipulate its discoveries for the
benefit of those who are already "benefiting"
from the largesse of society.
Instead of being humble and grateful, it
tends to make human's arrogant
and greedy...
This we have to set right.

switch.text: One could say that physics preceded mathematics....

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe center; justify-content: unsafe center; width: 1px; height: 1px; padding-top: 1953px; margin-left: 155px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0px; text-align: center;
display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; white-space: nowrap;

div.div: But I have yet to convince you that Truth = Wisdom.

switch.text: But I have yet to convince you that Truth = Wisd...

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe center; justify-content: unsafe center; width: 1px; height: 1px; padding-top: 2013px; margin-left: 145px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0px; text-align: center;
display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; white-space: nowrap;

div.div:
So I will say it this way:
Truth is form. Wisdom is the spirit of Truth.
It is hidden in the essence of everything.
And can be used to understand
the principle behind the form.

switch.text: So I will say it this way:...

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe center; justify-content: unsafe flex-start; width: 1px; height: 1px; padding-top: 50px; margin-left: 572px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0px; text-align: left;
display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; white-space: nowrap;

div.div:
Knowledge (Da'at) enables you
to understand (Binah)
In order to attain wisdom, one
needs to plumb the depths of the
hidden seeking the One/Unity that
in the depths of the engagement.

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe center; justify-content: unsafe flex-start; width: 1px; height: 1px; padding-top: 160px; margin-left: 602px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0px; text-align: left;
display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; white-space: nowrap;

div.div:
Knowledge enables you to discern
what is true, whereas
Wisdom enables you to realise
the truth of things (the thing).

a.text: Text is not SVG - cannot display
